rationale: All figures describe 'Structural equation models,' which are inherently causal models depicting relationships between variables. Figure 1 is chosen as it represents the most fundamental 'Structural equation model' for a fixed-effects meta-analysis without covariates, serving as a foundational causal structure upon which the other models build. The term 'Structural equation model' directly implies a causal framework, aligning with the criteria for identifying a causal model.
